Name: RBF
Description: The RBF kernel is a stationary kernel. It is also known as the “squared exponential” kernel. It is parameterized by a length-scale parameter $l>0$, which can either be a scalar (isotropic variant of the kernel) or a vector with the same number of dimensions as the inputs $x$ (anisotropic variant of the kernel).

Name: Matern
Description: The Matern kernel is a stationary kernel and a generalization of the RBF kernel. It has an additional parameter $v$ which controls the smoothness of the resulting function. It is parameterized by a length-scale parameter $l>0$, which can either be a scalar (isotropic variant of the kernel) or a vector with the same number of dimensions as the inputs (anisotropic variant of the kernel).

Name: Periodic
Description: The periodic kernel recognizes ciclic patterns in the data. It is able to model data with repretitive behavior.

Name: Polynomial
Description: The polynomial kernel measures how similar two vectors are in a polynomial space.
